Domain.short_description: Distinct field of knowledge with its own concepts, methods and discourse.

Discipline.short_description: Organized body of knowledge with formal methods and principles.

Paradigm.short_description: Fundamental pattern of thinking and inquiry in field of study.

Discourse.short_description: System of thought and communication around particular subjects.

Category.short_description: Fundamental division or classification of knowledge or phenomena.

Framework.short_description: Structured system for organizing and understanding information.

Schema.short_description: Pattern or structure for organizing and interpreting knowledge.

Archive.short_description: Collected body of knowledge preserved in systematic way.

Canon.short_description: Authorized or accepted body of works or principles.

Tradition.short_description: Transmitted body of knowledge and practices through time.

System.short_description: Organized body of knowledge with internal coherence.

Method.short_description: Organized approach to acquiring or organizing knowledge.

Practice.short_description: Applied body of knowledge expressed through action.

Art.short_description: Domain of creative or skilled knowledge expression.

Science.short_description: Systematic study using empirical methods and evidence.

Doctrine.short_description: Formally stated system of beliefs or principles.

Theory.short_description: Systematic framework explaining phenomena or practice.

Philosophy.short_description: Investigation of fundamental nature of knowledge and reality.

Language.short_description: System of symbols and meanings for expressing knowledge.

Branch.short_description: Major division or subfamily within larger field.

School.short_description: Distinct tradition of thought or practice within field.

Movement.short_description: Evolution of thought or practice in particular direction.

Dialectic.short_description: Development of knowledge through opposing viewpoints.

Episteme.short_description: Historical system of understanding and knowledge formation.

Corpus.short_description: Complete body of knowledge or work in field.

Medium.short_description: Form or vehicle through which knowledge is transmitted.

Narrative.short_description: Knowledge structured through storytelling and meaning-making.

Praxis.short_description: Integration of theory and practice in knowledge application.

Metaphysics.short_description: Study of fundamental nature of reality and knowledge.

Logic.short_description: System of reasoning and knowledge validation.

Ideology.short_description: System of ideas and ideals forming worldview.

Discourse Field.short_description: Space of possible statements and knowledge claims.

Semiotics.short_description: Study of signs and symbols in meaning-making.

Ontology.short_description: Classification of entities and their relationships.

Epistemology.short_description: Theory of knowledge and how it is acquired.

Phenomenology.short_description: Study of structures of consciousness and experience.
